title: Process of data aquisition and model building
Process of data aquisition and model building
text: Natural Language Processing (NLP), a sub-field of Artificial Intelligence, offers an exciting opportunity to extract structured data from text to create a structured database. NLP can be trained to understand human language, enabling the extraction of valuable information from newspaper articles for further analysis. To delve deeper into NLP, you can read more about it in the article Natural Language Processing. In my own exploration of NLP, I utilized its capabilities by training a custom entity recognition model. This model allowed me to extract specific data from newspaper articles, making it easier to analyze and derive insights. To learn more about Named Entity Recognition (NER), which is a fundamental technique in NLP, you can refer to the article Named Entity Recognition.

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
text:

The schemer shows the nine step process of data aquisition and model training.

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
Process of data aquisition and model building
section: Process of annotation to fine tune the LLM
text:
Process of annotation to fine tune the LLM
I used a free online annotation tool called tecoholic to annotate 21 variables of interest using 150 newspaper articles that reported road traffic accidents in 2021. The trained model was the used to extract key variables from 300 newspaper articles from 2021 to 2023












Figure 2: Process of annotation

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
text:
Performance of the model
The model performed well on unseen newspaper articles averaging 70% performance across all metrics:

ENTS_P: Precision score for named entities: measures the proportion of correctly identified named entities out of all predicted named entities. Higher values indicate better precision.
ENTS_R: Recall score for named entities: Recall measures the proportion of correctly identified named entities out of all actual named entities. Higher values indicate better recall.
ENTS_F: F1 score for named entities: measure of the model’s accuracy in identifying named entities, considering both precision and recall. Higher values indicate better performance.
SCORE: Represents an overall score: that combines multiple metrics to evaluate the performance of the NER pipeline. Higher values indicate better overall performance.










Model training results

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
text:
Model deployment
The final process was deployement of the model to 300 newspaper articles on road traffic accidents to obtain a structured dataset. ::: {layout-ncol=“1”}  :::

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
text:
Results from the analysis
To view the results from this analysis, please refer to a separate blog on

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
text:
Implications
The study’s insights on Named Entity Recognition (NER) performance in text mining have broad implications across various applications:

Information Extraction: Accurate NER enhances information extraction from unstructured text, benefiting tasks like news summarization, document analysis, and knowledge graph construction.
Knowledge Discovery: NER facilitates knowledge discovery by identifying and categorizing entities, supporting tasks such as trend analysis, market research, and social network analysis.
Search and Recommendation Systems: Integrating NER improves search and recommendation system accuracy by understanding user queries or preferences and providing targeted results.
Text Classification and Sentiment Analysis: NER contributes to text classification and sentiment analysis by identifying important entities, leading to more precise insights from text data.
Natural Language Understanding and Conversational AI: NER enhances natural language understanding and conversational AI systems by recognizing entities in user input, enabling better context understanding and response generation.
Data Integration and Linkage: NER aids data integration and linkage by identifying entities across datasets, supporting tasks like data harmonization and entity resolution for a unified data view.
NER as a Service: The study’s findings may lead to NER-as-a-service offerings, enabling organizations to leverage pre-trained NER models or APIs for streamlined integration into various systems and workflows.

title: Hi, I’m Daniel Eurien.
text:
Hi, I’m Daniel Eurien.
I am an Epidemiologist and Data Scientist passionate about integrating data science into public health and small-to-medium enterprises to drive profitability. I love data visualization, machine learning, and applying natural language processing in business intelligence. Through this blog, I share my impactful public good projects using my newly acquired skills.
To get started, you can check out my most popular content below. You can find me on Twitter or GitHub and linkedin. Feel free to reach out to me via mail and subscribe to my email newsletter.
